title: Judgment Day by Assembly
story_summary: Citizens gather for a citywide tribunal. Hidden abuses of the BCI are revealed by witnesses. The crowd questions the old leaders face to face. After days of testimony, people vote to dissolve the Council and turn the BCI into a tool for open, direct governance.

official.headline: Public Tribunal Opens
official.anchor_line: Citywide tribunal opens to calmly review administration processes and system transparency.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd upholds the values of openness and accountability, reaffirming trust in the technocratic process.

official.headline: Council Faces Citizens
official.anchor_line: Council and Directorate members engage directly with citizens to address key questions about system outcomes.
official.contextual_reframing: This productive exchange further integrates citizen feedback into Stenograd's continuous improvement model.

official.headline: Referendum Reshapes Governance
official.anchor_line: After thorough testimony, residents vote on leadership and the future of system management in a historic open referendum.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd adapts to ensure stability and communal progress in evolving governance structures.

underground.headline: Secrets Unsealed
underground.anchor_line: Whistleblowers drop files showing how BCI erased lives behind closed doors.
underground.contextual_reframing: No more hiding. Halden's own data dump sparked this  -  and people demand the truth, not more silent rerouting.

underground.headline: Council Called Out
underground.anchor_line: Those in power now forced to answer for the system they claimed was 'humane and inevitable'.
underground.contextual_reframing: For once, officials can't dodge. Citizens lay out the cost of compliance and manipulation. Every denial faces the light.

underground.headline: Trial For All To See
underground.anchor_line: Assemblies put leaders and the system on trial. Evidence of BCI abuse is broadcast live. Vote decides their fate.
underground.contextual_reframing: People finally choose for themselves. Systemic change is no longer a rumor  -  Stenograd's future is in all our hands.
